programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: An auction is held on Darrell and Brandon's home turf, and Mary hatches a plan to deal with inflated prices.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Las Vegas, where they acquire a 1950s bumper car and a potato gun launcher.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid for large units in Las Vegas, discovering an antique naval cane sword and a magician's prop from the 1970s.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend fiercely competitive auctions in Garland, where Moe and Mary find a rare historical artefact.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers visit the Dallas suburb of Addison, where the Rangers find a nautical antique and Jenny uncovers a piece of Hollywood memorabilia.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron agrees to a controversial deal, and Rick restores a 1960s motorcycle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team works on a custom-made car from a 1940s fairground ride, and a client brings in an unusual bicycle.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The price of hides goes up, giving Troy a money-making idea. RJ and Jay Paul go in search of a large gator that has been terrorising fishermen.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Turtleman Ernie Brown Jr encounters a houseboat full of critters. Meanwhile, snapping turtles are stranded in cooling pipes and threaten a local distillery's production.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Ernie Brown Jr tries to retrieve a critter that has built a den in an abandoned house - and it is in the creature's best interests to leave with the property due to be demolished.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revisit some of the most expensive items in the shop as Pawn Stars splash the cash for a 1961 Fender Stratocaster guitar, Mickey Mouse display items and Star Wars memorabilia.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars revisit some of the most wicked items to ever come in the shop - a thermonuclear weapon warhead cover, a desk with a dark secret and a collection of knives.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley hires a woman to work at the jewellery counter, without consulting with Seth or Les. Questions about Ashley's skills are raised after suspicious transactions.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les orders Seth and Rich to clean up the warehouse to make room for new merchandise. When nothing is done, the owner has doubts that his children are cut out for business.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate why so many UFOs have been spotted near remote islands, and consider whether the remote outposts could be the earthly homes of aliens.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A locker at an auction in Arlington catches Vic's eye, but Bubba suspects it could have been used for shady dealings.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba are cautiously optimistic as they head to auctions in Mesquite, Nevada, a location that has not proven to be particularly fruitful for them in the past.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: American Jewelry celebrates its 30th anniversary, and Les wants to put on a big celebration He assigns Seth and Ashley five days to plan it, but they clash over their ideas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A sloppy mistake puts the Golds' business in jeopardy, and a dispute on the shop floor gets out of hand.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Members of the team get their hands on a rare photograph of Albert Einstein and a collection of top-secret documents from the Pentagon.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy plans to buy a locker full of collectibles in Mission Hills, while Darrell and Mary hope to make an easy profit, but find the local bidders do not give up without a fight.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy bids on some vintage items at auctions in Palm Springs, and Darrell and Rene compete against each other.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones attend an auction in Los Angeles, where they acquire an autographed 1960s tattoo machine, a competition chainsaw and a cedar bear.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones buy a fighting cage and a vintage carnival game in California.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders go head to head in a series of tense locker auctions in Oak Cliff, where they bid for a unit of antique electronics and a strange vaudeville curio.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: You Bought It, You Break It
programme.desc: Fortune seems to favour Moe and Mary when they visit Mesquite, Nevada, the town where Ricky and Bubba experienced their infamous losing streak.

programme.title: Air Crash Special Report
programme.desc: Investigating the potential hazards of commercial air travel. Technicians use data from the Delta Airlines Flight 191 tragedy to develop safer and more robust aircraft.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries, beginning with a rock bearing a cryptic design that was discovered in Roswell, New Mexico, in 2004.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes an in-depth look at extra-terrestrial mysteries. Here, he investigates whether the religious relic the Ark of the Covenant could hold connections to an extraterrestrial past.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les shocks the others when he reveals his plans to buy a new store. Meanwhile, a man wanting to pawn his VCR causes a scene, and another tries to get money for his fake eye.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes into detail about his plans for a new pawn store, and Ashley is caught in the crossfire when a fight breaks out in the middle of the floor.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: At the new shop, the Golds are surprised to find a bag of gems inside a former employee's desk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones find a miniature antique firearm and a collection of unique remote-controlled vehicles at an auction in California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid for a 1970s dune buggy and a vintage pool table at a desert auction in Palm Springs, California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: As Beth receives devastating news about her cancer, Dog and the team are contacted by Leland to chase Manuel, who has fled to Hawaii, and Cristin, a girl who has skipped bail.

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Specialist treasure hunters the Pirates Inc race to take advantage of a massive opportunity involving a drug transportation plane. However, the potential profit comes with huge risk.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The competition grows fierce at auctions in North Hollywood, and even Dan and Laura struggle to stay ahead of the game.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave gets help from his friends at a vault auction, but Mary's inexperience leaves her empty-handed.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis serve up their unique festive take in a Christmas special filled with seasonal material, out-takes, best bits and hitherto unseen moments.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets his celebrity contestants challenges involving snowglobes, rubber ducks and wooden spoons. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actress Tracey Ullman hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz from April 2018, with comedian James Acaster and Sky News journalist Beth Rigby joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests David Mitchell, Rob Brydon, Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions on the topic of history, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Simon becomes a sperm donor to raise extra rent money, while a patient in Anthony's care starts behaving wildly when they are awoken from a coma. With guest star Sally Lindsay.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Lucas and Adam visit a huge collection of military items and vehicles just outside of Melbourne.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: As Mike and Frank continue their pick through Alabama, Danielle finds them a collector with a shocking stash of high voltage oddities.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Scott goes all out to win at an auction, while Lori and Chrissy clash.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Tarrell 'T-Money' Wright makes a shocking revelation, while a group of new bidders comes to town.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank stumble on a surprise find in a man-cave full of cars. They also encounter an eccentric seller who answers to an otherworldly power.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are feeling lucky as they head to the huge stockpile of a Kentucky collector who is desperate to sell his collection before his roof caves in.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Bryan Jr recreates a couple's cosy log home that they lost in a fire, and Peter hopes to build his way into heaven by creating an entryway for the local church.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Jaguar XJ and races against the rotation of the Earth. James May travels to America to drive a Nasa Space Exploration Vehicle and Richard Hammond tests two of the most famous supercars of the 1980s - the Porsche 959 and the Ferrari F40. John Prescott is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.sub-title: Boat Move, Vintage Cars, Wood Ship
programme.desc: A 40-tonne boat called King Arthur needs moving from Bristol, while in Essex, a number of vintage cars must be carefully transported to a sales fair.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Mick Sweetmore's team tries to fix a radio issue in a bid to keep the new pursuit cars on the tail of Merseyside's criminals. There's a surprise visit from the fleet's oldest member, and the bosses get dirty hands when things go wrong on the road.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Reliant Robin to investigate the reasons behind the lack of three-wheeled cars on the market. The Stig takes the Bentley Continental Supersports for a spin around the test track, and James May fires up the Toyota Hilux for a final challenge - a gruelling drive up Eyjafjallajokull, an active Icelandic volcano that halted flights in British airspace in 2010

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three hosts are each given a budget of Â£5,000 to find a car that can hold its own on a racetrack and handle everyday tasks, before testing their purchases in Germany. James May puts two Porsches through their paces on the Top Gear test circuit, and former Downing Street communications director Alastair Campbell tries out the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to a series of celebrity guests, as Tim Vine encounters a wet bra, Alice Levine barely attempts cricket and Russell Howard makes a convincing liger.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Countdown presenter (and Apprentice sidekick) Nick Hewer squares off against his show's former maths whizz Carol Vorderman and comedian Rhod Gilbert, making the case with host Frank Skinner for their gripes and pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include train managers, camping, Facebook, golf, holidays and advertising slogans.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the light-hearted panel show, which sees comedy actress Miranda Hart, TV and radio host Reggie Yates and Countryfile presenter John Craven competing to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include stuffed marrows, spitting, the hip-hop handshake and Miranda's breasts.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show, asking questions about catastrophes, cosmonauts and coconuts of Bill Bailey, Dara O Briain, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Comedy Against Living Miserably
programme.desc: Stand-up comedy special, hosted and headlined by Joel Dommett, with support from Kiri Pritchard-Mclean, John Robins and Judi Love.

programme.title: Taskmaster: Champion of Champions
programme.desc: A two-part special welcoming back the champions from the first five series - Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Noel Fielding, Rob Beckett and Bob Mortimer.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas, Zoe Lyons, Sara Pascoe and Richard Osman are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Continuing the saga of Death Can Be Fatal, as well as a guest appearance from the Aldershot Brass Ensemble and Patrick Moore's brother.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Field Marshal Montgomery's daring airborne plan to end the war by Christmas, which went a bridge too far at Arnhem.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: This edition of the documentary series takes a look at the town of Sodom, which is thought to have existed in ancient Palestine.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: John Christie: Serial Killer - Part One
programme.desc: The first of two programmes looking at the case of John Christie, who murdered at least eight women, including his own wife.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The theories, conspiracies and facts relating to Rudolf Hess's dramatic flight to Scotland in 1941 and his subsequent death in Spandau prison.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Field Marshal Montgomery's daring airborne plan to end the war by Christmas, which went a bridge too far at Arnhem.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The fate of a Canadian warship that went to the aid of an American freighter rocked by an explosion in 1944. More than 60 years on, divers uncover new evidence of the sinking.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster Chris Tarrant continues his travels along the world's most challenging railways. Here he attempts to cross the Andes, setting off from the coast of Chile and heading for the Bolivian capital of Sucre. Along the way he traverses some of the driest and most inhospitable environments on the planet, hitches rides on unusual trains and deals with altitude sickness at more than 3,000 metres.

programme.title: The Day When
programme.sub-title: The Day When Hitler Lost the War
programme.desc: How the Nazi invasion of Russia in 1941 would lead directly to Hitler's ultimate downfall four years later.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: As the Allies' advances stall, the Canadians seize Hitler's island fortress to open up the vital port of Antwerp and keep the war moving.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A little-known dark past explains the vast monolithic structures that dominate the small British island of Guernsey.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: Dave and Steve spot something special at auction, but they're not the only ones on the trail of this First World War pilot's logbook.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Spoonerisms galore with Barker and Corbett, and another instalment of the gripping Death Can Be Fatal, with a musical finale to finish.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Continuing the saga of Death Can Be Fatal, as well as a guest appearance from the Aldershot Brass Ensemble and Patrick Moore's brother.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man admitted to hospital after a traffic accident turns out to be one of two children who disappeared without trace 15 years previously. At the time, a nationwide manhunt failed to produce any answers, and now the cold case squad investigates where the missing boy has been all this time and whether his twin sister is still alive. Detective drama, starring Trevor Eve.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina tries to quell suspicion about her unexplained absences by going on the beat with Amber and Dan - only to be punched hard in the stomach by a suspect. Smithy reprimands Margaret and Roger for gossiping about Ramani's state of mind, and Honey prepares to lie on Scott's behalf in a bid to get him out of jail, while Lance pledges to leave no stone unturned in his quest to secure incriminating evidence against gangster Adi Mateen.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A routine inspection of a theatre ends in tragedy when a lighting rig falls on top of Colin. Elsewhere, Hallam considers taking on a job outside the brigade.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward presents from Birmingham's Uplands Allotment, where an array of unusual plants and vegetables are on display.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy is forced to face his fear of heights head-on, and Army widow Joy Wilton gets a second chance at happiness, while Michael and Marsha's marriage shows further signs of crumbling. Starring Ben Nealon, Rob Spendlove, Denise Welch and Meera Syal.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy says farewell to the Fusiliers. Complications during a live firing exercise results in a secret coming up to the surface. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina tries to quell suspicion about her unexplained absences by going on the beat with Amber and Dan - only to be punched hard in the stomach by a suspect. Smithy reprimands Margaret and Roger for gossiping about Ramani's state of mind, and Honey prepares to lie on Scott's behalf in a bid to get him out of jail, while Lance pledges to leave no stone unturned in his quest to secure incriminating evidence against gangster Adi Mateen.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ric pushes to perform extreme surgery on one of his patients, with disastrous consequences for himself. Meanwhile, Owen finally decides between Chrissie and Diane.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sean and Chloe are sent to Holby police station to treat a prisoner injured by an angry mob who suspect him of shooting a local teenager _ but they are soon forced to go beyond the call of duty as events take a dramatic and dangerous turn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel and Sheelagh put their kiss behind them and work as a team, while Honey's wedding day ends in a brawl, forcing the registrar to abandon the ceremony. Smithy frets over Gina's refusal to take things easy, and Adam suffers a personal tragedy, leaving him racked with guilt at putting his job before the demands and responsibilities of family life.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle is still anxious about Vicky and can't seem to get over the shock of her abduction. Sharon wants to teach Grant a lesson.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle is still struggling with the trauma of Vickys kidnapping. She must deal with it when she comes face to face with kidnapper Ms. Whittingham.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blackwall firefighters called out to a BMX rider trapped beneath a collapsed wall, and an institute for juvenile offenders which has gone up in flames. On the domestic front, the team receive a letter from injured workmate Colin, while Kevin faces homelessness and Bayleaf grows disillusioned with the job. Starring James Hazeldine, Glen Murphy, Andrew Kazamia, Ross Boatman and Sean Blowers.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Hector's former Army pal and reputed jewel thief Toad returns to Britain determined to set the record straight with his old friend, leaving Archie and his father trying to decide whether or not to aid his escape from the police. Things get worse when Lexie accidentally puts a hole in a valuable regimental painting, leaving the cash-strapped estate facing a huge bill.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim searches for a runaway wife and becomes embroiled in a cult who believe in the existence of Atlantis. Detective drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack arrives home drunk, Aveline puts her desire for a baby on hold, and Nellie meets her admirer in the park.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.sub-title: Hey Diddle Diddle, Who's on the Fiddle?
programme.desc: Peggy finds a letter from Joe Maplin to Clive, leading the camp to believe they have a mole in their midst. Classic comedy, starring Su Pollard and David Griffin.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: With Alistair and Judith happily married, Harry tries to find the courage to ask Sandy to move to Canada with him, and Lionel has his usual doubts about his relationship with Jean when she takes pity on a homeless girl. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Behind Every Bush There Is Not Necessarily a Howard
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists his friends in a scheme to help Toby win back his ex-wife - but finds she only has eyes for Morton. Meanwhile, Howard tries to keep Pearl from interfering with his bike ride with Marina, and Cooper and Walsh test a new piece of in-car technology. Long-running rural comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Trevor Bannister, Peter Sallis and Burt Kwouk.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Everard hands down a lenient sentence to a political benefactor accused of running over a mother and her two children. Deed accuses him of corruption, and Monty responds by putting pressure on Jo, ostracising her to the point where she begs her friend to back down. True to form, John continues to push for the result he wants a tougher sentence but there may be a price for him to pay.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A mummified body found on a derelict aeroplane leads Boyd and the team to a man convicted in a similar case, who Spence gets to know undercover. The victim's uncle reveals the dead man's connections with a corrupt businessman selling fake drugs - but a tragedy foils the detectives' work. Crime drama, starring Trevor Eve and Wil Johnson.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today with Gillian Joseph.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Serial Killer with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: The broadcaster meets Bronx businessman Alex Henriquez, who was convicted for three murders in 1992. The victims had two things in common - they were all asphyxiated before being dumped by the highway and all three could be placed with Alex Henriquez shortly before their deaths. For 30 years the killer has protested his innocence, claiming the police set him up. Piers Morgan tries to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Trish returns to the scene of the crime in the hope it will prompt her to remember something more about the attack, while DC Katie Harford thinks she has a strong lead when she discovers a new suspect who doesn't have an alibi. Cath reveals interesting new information about the night of her party, while a match is made for the male DNA found on Trish. An unknown woman walks into the police station - and delivers some devastating new information when interviewed by Ellie and Hardy. Crime drama, starring David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh.

programme.title: Scotland Revealed Moments
programme.desc: Aerial views of the Cairngorms, presented by Vanessa Collingridge.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines the case of a woman who risked her life to escape a life of domestic abuse and coercive control. Plus, the parents of a teenager who was killed in a hit and run incident by a driver racing at 60mph in a 20mph zone share their story.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five family and friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants who have never met before pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Dr Ranj: On Call
programme.desc: Dr Ranj Singh offers more advice on how to spot, treat and deal with some of the most common illnesses and accidents. As well as going over the latest medical news, the doctor witnesses first-hand what goes on under the knife during a kidney transplant. Kylie Pentelow also meets a young woman who survived terminal cancer following a breakthrough clinical trial.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Forest ranger Felicity Ward is blinded by mysterious lights while driving at night in the village of Cooper Hill and the next morning her car is found abandoned at the roadside, followed closely by the discovery of her body. Visiting UFO spotters in the village are convinced aliens are responsible, but as Barnaby and Nelson try to get to the truth, they unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets along the way. Michelle Collins, Steve Evets, Alison Steadman, Steve Oram and Pip Torrens guest star.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: Euston is evacuated during Friday rush hour - leaving passengers there and in Birmingham New Street station stranded, confused and angry. Driver Andy reveals just how close his train came to disaster on the tracks and train dispatcher and former bank manager David imparts his worldly wisdom to a new recruit on his first shift. A train runs a red signal at Birmingham, so engineers have to work through the night to move the stranded locomotive, investigate the cause and get things back up and running before the morning rush.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of 99 per cent of America's raisins in California's San Joaquin Valley. Plus, the manufacture of the world's oldest type of paper.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China decide the classic 1980s muscle car, the Ford Mustang GT, is the ideal, affordable vehicle for an aspiring mechanic to start working on.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Rain hampers Robbie's efforts to truck a home to the Gold Coast. Meanwhile, Graham faces storms and grass fires moving a section of railway 5,000 kilometres in just five days.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Teutul Sr meets governor Sarah Palin while researching a bike in Alaska, before heading for Finland to introduce OCC-style motorcycles to Europe.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Walter loves the futuristic look of his 1975 Bricklin - but it needs improvements to enhance the driving experience. Plus, Dan restores a 1963 split window Corvette.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe trains Alaskan huskies for sled work, but finds cleaning up frozen urine a less enjoyable task than helping with the newborn pups.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Custom Knee Braces/Ductless Air Conditioners/Window Film/Motorcycle Exhaust Systems
programme.desc: The development and production of custom knee braces, ductless air conditioners, window film and motorcycle exhaust systems.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Solid State Drives/Eye Shadow/Limousines/Dead Blow Hammers
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind the production of solid state drives, eye shadow, limousines and dead blow hammers.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How a caravan tougher than an SUV can be built. Plus, forging tuning forks with perfect pitch, resurfacing an ice rink in minutes, and staging on the world's biggest light festival.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien hope a clay pigeon trap, a searchlight and a Peugeot 205 will help make a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Three weeks of long hours and horrendous conditions cause tempers to fray and the men begin to turn on one another. Elsewhere, ice stands between a skipper and the safety of the harbour.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Gold fever is on the rise as the fleet races to find fortune before the season ends, and one miner turns treacherous by leaking valuable information to the competition.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Rain hampers Robbie's efforts to truck a home to the Gold Coast. Meanwhile, Graham faces storms and grass fires moving a section of railway 5,000 kilometres in just five days.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins renovation work on a 1984 Jeep CJ7, replacing the suspension and shock absorbers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China tries to fit the new rear drum brakes and completes a few other jobs, before Mike Brewer tries to sell the vehicle on for a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits the Lee Roy Hartung collection, where he discovers an original Hertz car from the 1920s and a one-off 1949 Veritas.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini hopes a fishing rod and canoe will add to the value of his 1939 Ford Standard Woodie Wagon.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien hope a clay pigeon trap, a searchlight and a Peugeot 205 will help make a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.desc: The SS Marine Electric, which sank in a storm off the coast of Virginia, killing 31 sailors. The Coast Guard turned up a shocking cause for the disaster.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crews fish for crabs off the coast of Alaska, battling freezing spray, mountainous waves and sub-zero temperatures. As they try to make their way back to St Paul's Harbour, they discover it is frozen shut by Arctic pack ice.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: The tides are turning in Nome, Alaska, as the season comes to a close.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a luxury fabric manufacturer in Suffolk, Drew Pritchard is impressed by historic silks once used in the royal household. Plus, in Scotland, he haggles with a young baron.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: A cyclone threatens tanker driver Michael's delivery of hazardous chemicals to a desert mine site. Meanwhile, Tasmanian trucker Lindsay transports 80,000 angry bees to a rainforest.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China decide the classic 1980s muscle car, the Ford Mustang GT, is the ideal, affordable vehicle for an aspiring mechanic to start working on.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to East Sussex in their hunt to discover valuable items 'lost' in people's homes, with their finds including some Victorian street lamps.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard enjoys a day at an amusement park in Berkshire, before receiving a lesson in dentistry in Newcastle. The presenter then concludes his antique-hunting journey around the UK by flipping a coin on a deal in Yorkshire.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Blackburn, the demo crew calls time on a brewing icon. Meanwhile, in the West Midlands an artist picks up the pieces to bring new life to an old motor.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team takes on an antique plate camera, a dilapidated piece of designer furniture and a violin that spent the Second World War in Auschwitz concentration camp.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they use ancient techniques and modern technology to produce thousands of tonnes of barbecue charcoal? How do they cook up Japan's soba noodles?.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they grow America's only freshwater pearls in Tennessee? Plus, a look at how the world's sharpest knives are forged.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Insight into the manhunt for tracker Claude Dallas, who shot two sheriffs dead before disappearing into the mountains of Idaho. Knowing Dallas could stay hidden indefinitely, the FBI were forced to employ unique tactics and set up a modern-day posse to track him down.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The death of an Air Force Officer's wife appears to be a tragic accident, but closer inspection of the scene reveals more sinister circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The case of a young boy who disappeared during a house fire and whose body was found 50 miles away from home. However, the killer had been careless, and the evidence he left behind - including vomit stains and paint particles - led police directly towards him.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When the body of Fernando Silva was found, the crime scene revealed little about what caused his death. Police turned to CCTV to find out what happened.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The July 1999 murders of Diana Algar and her friend Jose Molina. Three letters scrawled across Algar's living room wall offered a key clue in a US-wide manhunt. Two drifters who Auger had allowed to lodge in her Pennsylvania home were later found guilty of the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A pair of lecturers are found murdered at their home in New Hampshire, and detectives are baffled when there is no sign of forced entry and neighbours confirm their popularity.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Senior investigator Debby MacDonald and her partner find a starving dog in a house that is familiar to the team.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown meets Monty, the kid goat that cannot stop scratching, and Lisa treats a terrified German shepherd puppy. A feisty 42-year-old galah has an unappetising problem.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Brooke tells Dianne and Randy that her budget is $7,000, leading to an awkward conversation when her mother reveals it is actually $4,000

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bodybuilder wants a dress that makes her look big, and a bride plots an elaborate wedding at the Grand Canyon.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is desperate to save the life of a frail three-day old foal that has just been orphaned. Plus, Dr Lisa Chimes is trying to help a greedy cat that ate a 50cm ribbon.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown looks after Lulu, a sneezing Labradoodle, while Dr Lisa Chimes strives to a save a dog that has been bitten by an infected tick.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: As summer arrives, temperatures soar to more than 100 degrees. Mark rescues a skinny Rottweiler chained out in the sun and investigators seek out kittens trapped under roof tiles.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team springs into action when a dog and her nine puppies need rescuing from a storm drain before the rain arrives.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The work of investigators and scientists at the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms who are dedicated to preventing terrorism and reducing violent crime.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Rico Harris, a former Harlem Globetrotter, who vanished in October 2014 while driving on a long trip to Seattle. Harris' car was found abandoned in a park 60 miles north-west of Sacramento and his mobile phone was located nearby. Investigators embarked on a quest that grew more baffling as time passed.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case in which Robert Hoagland disappeared when he failed to pick up his wife Lori at an airport. Police found his car miles from home with his son Max still inside, who revealed his father had run into some shady men a few days earlier. The mystery deepened further when security video captured at a petrol station showed Hoagland buying a map.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which two young women failed to return home from the local drive-thru. As their parents began a search for them, a fisherman gave police their first clue.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Two friends want the same dress for their wedding, while another pair of customers try to keep their gowns secret from each other.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride and her mother who are both over six feet tall struggle to find dresses for the big day. A customer who has tried more than 80 gowns still cannot make up her mind.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: An American football player puts a limit on his sister's budget when she takes a liking to an expensive dress, and a designer has very specific ideas for her friend's gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country singer Jerrod Niemann's fiancee visits the shop, and the mother of another customer is determined to see her daughter in white.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride who chose to elope tries to make peace with her parents by involving them in her choice of dress. Another customer wants a gown fit for a queen.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride wants a look inspired by her favourite singer, and another customer finds her ideas being undermined by her opinionated entourage.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore saves items from the tip in Walsall, with blacksmith Bex Simon coming up with a new use for metal shelves and upholsterer Anthony Devine revamping an armchair.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield, boss Dan values some African-inspired art, while customer Sarah hopes to secure a big cash deal by selling her diamond earrings.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part two of two. Milla goes outside for the first time in five months, and Charity tries to rebuild a fractured relationship.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The work of the FBI's crime laboratory as investigators work to track down the eco-anarchist Unabomber Theodore Kaczynski.
